availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marion, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Crittenden County, Kentucky native. Son of Logan Armstrong and Mary Dean Armstrong. Married to Mary Eliza Wilson in Crittenden County, Kentucky on March 13, 1845. Father of Mary R. Armstrong, Malinda J. Armstrong, M.L. Armstrong, and L.F. Armstrong. Farmer in Caldwell, Kentucky, in 1850. Merchant in Marion, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 30th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as Private from September 2, 1861 to October 9, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Find A Grave, "Alfred Armstrong (1811-1866)," Memorial #64972083, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64972083 (accessed April 20, 2019).
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell, District 1, p. 311B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, Marion (West Half), p. 406.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Crittenden County Marriages, Film 000558428, p. 15.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Ohio, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M552, Roll 0003.
Ohio, Soldier Grave Registrations, 1804-1958. Ohio History Connectm, Columbus, Ohio. (accessed through Fold3, April 20, 2019).
